SEARCH
Package io.brane.rpc

Record Class WebSocketConfig

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
io.brane.rpc.WebSocketConfig
Record Components:
url - the WebSocket URL (ws:// or wss://)
maxPendingRequests - maximum concurrent in-flight requests (must be power of 2)
ringBufferSize - Disruptor ring buffer size (must be power of 2)
waitStrategy - Disruptor wait strategy type
defaultRequestTimeout - default timeout for requests (null = no timeout)
connectTimeout - connection establishment timeout
ioThreads - number of Netty I/O threads (typically 1 for minimal context switching)
public record WebSocketConfig(String url, int maxPendingRequests, int ringBufferSize, WebSocketConfig.WaitStrategyType waitStrategy, Duration defaultRequestTimeout, Duration connectTimeout, int ioThreads, @Nullable io.netty.channel.EventLoopGroup eventLoopGroup) extends Record
Configuration for WebSocketProvider.

This record provides fine-grained control over the WebSocket provider's behavior, including Disruptor settings, timeout configuration, and threading options.

Usage: 


 WebSocketConfig config = WebSocketConfig.builder("wss://eth.example.com")
         .maxPendingRequests(32768)
         .ringBufferSize(8192)
         .waitStrategy(WaitStrategyType.BLOCKING)
         .defaultRequestTimeout(Duration.ofSeconds(30))
         .build();

 WebSocketProvider provider = WebSocketProvider.create(config);

Wait Strategy Guidelines:

  • WebSocketConfig.WaitStrategyType.YIELDING - Ultra-low latency, higher CPU usage. Best for HFT/MEV.
  • WebSocketConfig.WaitStrategyType.BLOCKING - Lower CPU usage, slightly higher latency. Best for enterprise/batch.
Since:
0.2.0
